009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * This is an implementation of the algebraic circle fitting algorithm described in [1].
021 * This algorithm is among the oldest and simplest algebraic circle fitting methods.
022 * This implementation closely follows the original paper. The only difference is the
023 * use of a numerical solver (as compared to using the inverse of matrix M) for
024 * solving the 3x3 linear system.
025 * Its performance is sufficient if points are sampled over a large part of the circle.
026 * It shows significant bias (estimated circles are too small) when sample points are 
027 * confined to a small segment of the circle. It fails when matrix M becomes singular.
028 * Fits to exactly 3 (non-collinear) points are handled properly.
029 * Data centering is used to improve numerical stability (alternatively, a reference
030 * point can be specified).
031 * 
032 * <p>
033 * [1] I. Kåsa. "A circle fitting procedure and its error analysis",
034 * <em>IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement</em> <strong>25</strong>(1), 
035 * 8–14 (1976).
036 * </p>
037 * 
038 * @author WB
039 * 
040 */
041public class CircleFitKasaA extends CircleFitAlgebraic {
042
043        private final double[] q;       // q = (A,B,C,D) algebraic circle parameters
044        
045        /**
046         * Constructor.
047         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point.
048         * 
049         * @param points sample points
050         */
051        public CircleFitKasaA(Pnt2d[] points) {
052                this(points, null);
053        }
054        
055        /**
056         * Constructor.
057         * The centroid of the sample points is used as the reference point for data
058         * centering if {@code null} is passed for {@code xref}.
059         * 
060         * @param points sample points
061         * @param xref reference point or {@code null}
062         */
063        public CircleFitKasaA(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
064                this.q = fit(points, xref);
065        }
066        
067        @Override
068        public double[] getParameters() {
069                return q;
070        }
071        
072        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] pts, Pnt2d xref) {
073                final int n = pts.length;
074                if (n < 3) {
075                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 points are required");
076                }
077                
078                if (xref == null) {
079                        xref = PntUtils.centroid(pts);
080                }
081                final double xr = xref.getX();
082                final double yr = xref.getY();
083
084                // calculate sums:
085                double sx = 0, sy = 0;
086                double sxy = 0, sxx = 0, syy = 0;
087                double sxxx = 0, syyy = 0;
088                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
089                        final double x = pts[i].getX() - xr;
090                        final double y = pts[i].getY() - yr;
091                        final double x2 = sqr(x);
092                        final double y2 = sqr(y);
093                        sx   += x;
094                        sy   += y;
095                        sxx  += x2;
096                        syy  += y2;
097                        sxy  += x * y;
098                        sxxx += x2 * x + y2 * x;        // = x^3 + x * y^2
099                        syyy += y2 * y + x2 * y;        // = y^3 + x^2 * y
100                }
101                
102                double sz = sxx + syy;
103                
104                double[][] X = {                                // = D in the paper
105                                { 2 * sx,  2 * sy,  n},
106                                { 2 * sxx, 2 * sxy, sx},
107                                { 2 * sxy, 2 * syy, sy}};
108            
109                double[] b = {sz, sxxx, syyy};   // RHS vector (= E in the paper)
110                
111                // find exact solution to 3x3 system M * q = b (using a numerical solver):
112                double[] qq = Matrix.solve(X, b); // = Q in the paper, qq = (B,C,D)
113                
114                double B = -2 * qq[0];
115                double C = -2 * qq[1];
116                double D = -qq[2];
117                
118                // re-adjust for data centering
119                RealMatrix M = getDecenteringMatrix(xr, yr);
120                return M.operate(new double[] {1, B, C, D});    // q = (A,B,C,D)
121        }
122
123}
